title: Great American Railroad Journeys 10of15 Wilmington to Havre de G
description:
Great American Railroad Journeys

Travel Documentary hosted by Michael Portillo, published by BBC in 2016 - English narration 
http://docuwiki.net/images/f/fb/Great-American-Railroad-Journeys-Cover.jpg

Information
------------------------------

Great American Railroad Journeys
Michael Portillo crosses the Atlantic to ride the railroads of America, armed with Appleton's General Guide to the United States, published in 1879.



10)  Wilmington to Havre de Grace 
Armed with his Appleton's Guide, Michael Portillo reaches a milestone on his American journey: the boundary between the northern and southern states, known as the Mason-Dixon line. He discovers the origins of what became for black Americans the border between slavery and freedom, in an 18th-century English dispute over land. On the Wilmington and Western Railroad, Michael meets the passenger train Phoebe Snow, created by the railroads at the turn of the 20th century to reassure passengers that clean burning coal wouldn't make their clothes dirty. Michael uncovers the explosive history of gunpowder production in Delaware, begun by a Frenchman, whose chateau still stands. He then takes a boat trip up the Susquehanna River following the route taken by one of the first English settlers, John Smith.
